dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so today, um, we're diving into something super relevant: how to adapt to all these new realities, you know, with global disruptions and everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so today, um, we're diving into something super relevant: how to adapt to all these new realities, you know, with global disruptions and everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, like, a huge topic right now. The core message I got from the article is really about re-educating yourself, right? To deal with this growing wave of challenges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, like, a huge topic right now. The core message I got from the article is really about re-educating yourself, right? To deal with this growing wave of challenges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key in being able to efficiently deal with the growing wave of challenges around us is in re-educating yourself.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And the first step they mention, which I thought was really foundational, is just that: working on your foundation. Like, self-reflection.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And the first step they mention, which I thought was really foundational, is just that: working on your foundation. Like, self-reflection.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are five strategic steps you can follow to re-educate yourself for new realities Work on your foundation...it is strategically very important to devote some of your time to self-reflection in order to assess your most important asset yourself, especially your soft skills!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. [Host_A: Your most important asset, yourself!] Exactly! And zeroing in on those critical soft skills. Like agility, emotional intelligence, leadership. What your boss, or friends even, value most about you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. Exactly! And zeroing in on those critical soft skills. Like agility, emotional intelligence, leadership. What your boss, or friends even, value most about you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You should identify, update and study the most critical soft skills that your boss, colleagues or friends value most about you (e.g., agility, motivation, emotional intelligence (EI), leadership).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, is a great segue into diversifying your assets, right? The article mentioned that Facebook report, how skill gaps are just widening.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, is a great segue into diversifying your assets, right? The article mentioned that Facebook report, how skill gaps are just widening.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recently released LinkedIn 2020 Workplace Learning Report comprised data from almost 500,000,000 professionals, mapped into a list of the 15 most in-demand soft and hard skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild how quickly things change. You really need to be thinking about new hard skills, especially, uh, ICT-related ones. Not everyone needs to be a programmer, but, like, you need to be ready for the labor market in the next couple of years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild how quickly things change. You really need to be thinking about new hard skills, especially, uh, I C T-related ones. Not everyone needs to be a programmer, but, like, you need to be ready for the labor market in the next couple of years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This does not mean that everyone should become a programmer or expert in artificial intelligence (AI); but it implies that everyone should consider mastering additional in-demand hard skills to be ready for the huge changes in the labor market that are foreseeable within the next 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And speaking of new realities, remote work! I think everyone has, uh, experienced that rollercoaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And speaking of new realities, remote work! I think everyone has, uh, experienced that rollercoaster.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! From that initial, like, enthusiasm to, um, [Host_A: Emotional exhaustion!] Exactly! And realizing it requires a whole new set of sophisticated skills. Time management, people management... how do you handle your family interrupting a call? *laughs*
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! From that initial, like, enthusiasm to, um, Exactly! And realizing it requires a whole new set of sophisticated skills. Time management, people management... how do you handle your family interrupting a call?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In many places, the enthusiasm of the first week of working from home office gave way to a collapse of productivity and emotional exhaustion after the second and third weeks onward. Many people discovered that it requires additional sets of sophisticated skills, including... a need for meticulous time management and people management proficiencies

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a real skill right there! And then, um, they talked about reinventing yourself online. Like, your digital presence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a real skill right there! And then, um, they talked about reinventing yourself online. Like, your digital presence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reinventing yourself online In the era of social distancing, the only way to stay visible and close to your colleagues in your work field is to be active in social networking and even in this field staying ahead means being very professional in social networking skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, like, more crucial than ever in this social distancing era. Polishing your LinkedIn, getting rid of those annoying typos, professionalizing your social networking skills.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, like, more crucial than ever in this social distancing era. Polishing your LinkedIn, getting rid of those annoying typos, professionalizing your social networking skills.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You should by polishing your bio and profile on LinkedIn and other professional and job search websites, and learning how to get rid of those small but annoying typos, sloppy sentences and incomplete thoughts and ideas. It is important to reinvent yourself in cyberspace by updating and professionalizing your social networking, media marketing and social media communication skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, not just *being* online, but being *professional* online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, not just being online, but being professional online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then, the final step, which I think ties it all together, is just learning about learning. There are so many MOOCs out there, but you have to choose wisely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then, the final step, which I think ties it all together, is just learning about learning. There are so many M O O C s out there, but you have to choose wisely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Learning about learning The power of online learning offers a lot of opportunities to fill the skill-gap, but be careful not to head out on a wild goose chase; instead, choose carefully and wisely the educational tools suitable for you. The opportunities for online learning are endless as thousands of universities and training organizations have launched massive open online courses (MOOCs) on hundreds of subjects!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's not just, um, randomly signing up for courses, but effectively using those tools to fill your specific skill gaps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's not just, um, randomly signing up for courses, but effectively using those tools to fill your specific skill gaps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Refine your learning process by effectively using your carte blanche of MOOCs and all those online studying tools and platforms, to choose the most efficient courses, modules and programs to fit your specific needs: this itself is an additional set of skills to acquire!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Knowing how to learn efficiently *is* a skill in itself now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Knowing how to learn efficiently is a skill in itself now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...to choose the most efficient courses, modules and programs to fit your specific needs: this itself is an additional set of skills to acquire!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's a lot to chew on for, uh, anyone trying to stay competitive and, you know, thrive in this new landscape.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's a lot to chew on for, uh, anyone trying to stay competitive and, you know, thrive in this new landscape.

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Itâ€™s all about continuous evolution.
